title: Need help (Break The Meta)

replies.body:
when you're a fucking god like me anything can work but because i have no idea what you're capable of, you should start off with semi-viable stuff like tanky dps evelynn top. then move to the real shit like brand jungle, ryze jungle, jinx jungle, urgod jungle, etc.

also im a rank 5 karthus jungle. its good fun, however you go runic and roa and take stormraiders. no tear.
Lol have you even been accused of cheating because of playing a lot? xP

Still is and even is buffed with her w working on monsters now aha.

from the wiki on Sivir's W:
> * Attacks on Sivir's primary target will apply other on-hit effects as normal but secondary targets will not be affected by any at all.
    * On-hit effects on the primary target will not modify damage dealt to secondary ones. 

Only the first target from the w will get affected by all the on-hit damage and frozen mallet, but you'll have very close to 2.5 AS so you'll be able to kill and switch targets with ease.

Maybe switch your {{item:3006}} for {{item:3085}} so you can better AOE your on-hit? Sivir already has movespeed from passive and ult.

I generally like to have boots on every build and I thought w applied on hit affects to all hit targets since i'm pretty sure I slowed everyone when I had frozen mallet on my adc build (since they had rengar top, eveylnn jungle and I got 0 peel and I was the only one with redtrinket)... eh ok well then this build is not viable since many other champions can go onhit runnans better like tristana, kogmaw, twitch or ashe.

you can get alot of armor pen on Sivir and build a {{item:3071}} with maybe a {{item:3085}}, then start a fight with W+AAs to shred multiple enemies then Q through all of them, since Black Cleaver's armor shred applies to ANY physical damage you deal.

I guess blackcleaver is nice for the rage passive which makes gives her a large enough ms boost when aa to surprise people and I sometimes build it since it provides some extra tank stats which are nice and lategame it does provide a teamwide armour shred but as the adc you'll be getting just as much armour pen from a lord dominicks regards and end up probably doing more damage unless most of your teams' damage is physical.

> [{quoted}](name=Nightjar,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=f11Q8wWq,comment-id=00050002,timestamp=2016-08-01T13:51:31.553+0000)
>
> Something I've really wanted to try is
> I don't know where {{champion:15}} 
> {{item:3124}} {{item:3153}} {{item:3091}} {{item:3115}} {{item:3022}}  {{item:3006}} 
> 
> Using her w to proc on hit effects on multiple targets. Her q also has some okay ap ratios though it's probably not nearly as good as her regular crit adc build but it looks kinda fun.
> If you just want to mix things up frozen mallet on sivir greatly increases her survivability and kiting potential and the bork can help shred through hp stacking tanks if the enemy team has alot of tanks. I use these very rarely but they're always interesting to have in your build and work well sometimes with her w.

let me know how frozen mallet on siv goes. I built it a looong time ago (like4 seasons ago, pre update) for shits and giggles and i remember the kiting was fun. speaking of which I really miss the boot upgrades.

I like buying the first tier of Frost Queen's claim as adc for extra gold between last hits and mana regen for spamming poke :D But the downside is we might not have enough stats to fight head on, still extra gold though if it fits well!$@#

if you want to do that cull is probably better for extended fights excluding the mana regen since it gives you better early level sustain and more gold value not to mention the frost queens will get cancelled every time you cs and it becomes a dead item and hence doesn't really give you gold value until extreme lategame if you have to refund it. Whereas cull offers a large immediate reward as soon as you complete the 100cs benchmark.

you would run frostqueens on ashe support though I guess.

* edit I meant spellthiefs

Nah I only buy the first tier, upgrading it is just wasteful on an adc with not much safe long range ap poke. I've only tried buying cull once I think because I team fight a lot rather than cs long enough to get 100cs after laning phase and farm champions instead lol. Cull's a **luxury item for me =/ (**an item I buy if my team has such a huge lead that we can make weird or 1vs3-5 item builds) .

you do realise the gold income from the spellthief line gets disabled if you get a cs. If you want to get a gold income item and you can't cs worth a damn then ancient coin would serve you better since it again gives you more sustain and a useful combat stat (cdr) and it's not entirely a dead item since it can situational but ok when finished. 
If you need more gold as an adc Cull is great item to snowball but only if you are really good as csing and 100cs during a 15min laning phase shouldn't really be hard for an adc (I'm a support/jg main so my csing is horrible but even I can get ~120cs during laning phase as the adc, so if you can get 100cs by 10min you'll probably win lane). Spellthiefs isn't actually gold efficient for an adc and if you just went doran's blade, you would have better combat stats and more ad which makes it easier to cs. Early combat stats are important for adc's. Spellthief is just not a good item on an adc unless you are atrocious at csing since spellthief can't earn you gold if you got a cs in the last 12s ( i think that's how long).

Basically, Cull = sustain through laning phase and snowball through cs gold lead, Doran's blade = Duel through laning phase, Spellthief = don't get cs and poke with mana which won't really work, since a good adc will just zone you since you can't out sustain them with hp and you can't duel them.

As a support main If I see an adc try to build spellthiefs, I swear to god I'll lose it. I don't care if my adc can't fight worth a damn, I can handle that, I'll fight and zone and they just farm and we can survive the laning phase and come out even. But if you build spellthiefs and don't get any cs, and can't get any gold and can't kill towers and objectives fast, what is the point of having you. ADC is a carry role and the support is there to protect you and make it easier for you get cs, so that lategame you can melt towers and dish out damage during a teamfight. Also if I see an enemy adc building spelltheifs it makes zoning them soo much easier, since they can't trade with me and so sure they might get a little gold from spellthiefs but they will have no cs and will be forced to back since I outsustain them and then they fall behind in levels and then I can 1v1 and kill them. Supports are gold efficent, adcs are not. ADCs needs as much gold as possible and a kill is only worth about 15cs, so if the enemy adc has 60 more cs than you. They have 4 more kills worth of gold. That's the difference between being fed and feeding in terms of pure gold and levels.

If you need csing practice, make a custom game, with nobody in it, and try to hit 10cs per minute with no interference and don't use abilities, only aa's and try to move around while doing it. Then do it with an intermediate bot, then 2. Try to get 10cs per minute and kill them when you can (but don't die and if you do miss cs to get a kill remember 1 kill = 15cs plus forcing them back so they miss cs), by trading with the bots with abilities and hitting them with aas when they try to get cs whilst not missing any of your cs. Even if this not as good as real laning; I promise you will be alot better as an adc. Do this every few weeks, and your csing, positioning, trading, lane control, forcing backs and getting a level advantage and generally winning any lane (aside from jg) will be remarkably better, allowing you to stomp enemy lanes that you might have lost to in the past.

That's why I don't push and harass between last hits... Not for when I'm not support lol. 

Maaate, most gold I've earned with fqc was about 3100-4000 gold on an ap Mf in an ARAM (the match was only 30-35minutes) match because i didn't trust my team and I carried halfway through to until the end of the match once they stopped Ramboing and feeding. Plus the gold earned periodically just for having the item and harassing between last hits by not pushing...(so the passive for harassing champions works) way more gold than cull. 

I said I don't cs once laning is finished, I just help my team farm champs and end the match fast if we get a lead early, instead of wasting time farming. I'm more of a pillager than a farmer lol. 

I don't like playing like a sock. 

I cs just fine. I just want extra gold to end even faster. I've been playing since 2011. I just play on  and off, and lose my rankings.
I didn't know you were talking about aram. That's a different matter. Though spelltheifs on summoners rift is not a good idea.
I do it on both maps -.-

The big point I'm trying to make is that spellthiefs is not good for adcs and the early combat stats often decide the laning phase, which is why my no.1 suggested item for adcs is dorans blade. Cull isn't as good as I made it sound and ancient coin isn't either. You should always go doran's blade as a first item, followed by a bf sword on first back and if you have the spare gold maybe a cull if even though you're ahead you don't have kill potential.

Lol Zig's going down half hp or more from one E cast by Miss Fortune is a lot of kill potential or Jhin's ult taking out half a tank Irela's hp on the final shot (Jhin ad caster build with Dominik's regards) because she didn't have enough armor.

I don't even go for kills or cs any more if any of my team is around, except support. Unless  they aren't last hitting or if an enemy might get away...or if the kill could save an ally. I had to redo the post in case of name and shame. https://i.imgsafe.org/54d87cb9c9.jpg https://i.imgsafe.org/54d937e42d.jpg https://i.imgsafe.org/54d9fe054c.jpg

I've been doing it for ages, especially if my team isn't trustworthy (e.g tank Yasuo jumping off every enemy while trying to get them to miss their skill shots and get their attention to waste everything on me while my team dealt damage because the enemy team were all burst champions that could kite and pop Yas meta build) but now I think I'm starting to attract some haters because of 8-10 win ratios in ARAM in solo que http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/team-recruitment/y3y9Hcgn-aram-team-serious-aram-players-only?comment=0009 + people having trolly builds but then they sell everything and buy meta to look normal at the end of the game -.-
Our mid, one game was afk from the start. I was playing rammus jg but had to mid lane v a kat. It was low to start but worked quite well

Ryze JG.

Honestly it is way better than mid, and since you can get blue buff without roaming all the from top it's a breeze. You have ult for surpRYZE ganks, can rush Runic Echoes for early damage and MS, stacking tear becomes very easy against jungle camps and a Catalyst gives some good sustain.

But it doesn't stop there. Only noobs get Rod of Ages when it has to stack and you aren't getting it first. Hextech GLP-800 becomes a great ganking addition as it provides the slow. It has the same passive as RoA, and gives some very respectable stats.

You can then transition into a standard situational Ryze build for maximum scrub wrecking potential. Your combo for ganking is usually Q-E-W-Q-E-Q, by then if they aren't dead then you still have movement speed and a shield to fix that. For jungling you have E-E-Q for AOE, can use W to kite and can E to finish a camp.

A very powerful pick still bearing the strong teamfighting potential of Ryze. For masteries you can take Thunderlord's or Stormraider's depending on your playstyle.

There is also a legendary bot lane combo that is a free win if your jungler knows how to play. Go Gnar ADC and Zilean support. Not going to into specifics but Gnar rushes Youmuus into Bork into Death's Dance into Black Cleaver, Zilean just builds AP and you dominate.

Gnar will max W so you get shredding and movement speed for poke or stacking rage, when you reach high rage Zilean can speed you up as you bounce E into mega form, land a sick ult and start destroying them. If you can't land a stun, Zilean can ult you while you go balls deep beating their squishy bot lane.

A great combo with a huge amount of CC, poke, damage and mobility.

* I absolutely love Orianna support (I played it from level 1-5 Orianna and will probably get 6&7 this way as well)
* I've been trying to make support Ahri work, but so far no luck :c
* Ashe/Caitlyn support! Not sure if they work as well as they used to, but i'll probably try them out later this week. 

Good luck ♥

Ahri support is kinda hard to make it work but I've seen some good player play her support.
Ashe and Caitlyn could possibly work sounds alright just not going to be as useful tho.
Thank you :)

Some other picks that i'm going to be doing some time this week that i've done before and know they work are.
Galio Support : Gives massive mr/amour buff to your adc plus wind speakers buff when finished mikaeles and locket also has good base damage/tankiness which that 5/4 man ultimate that can change team fights
Sivir Mid : One of my favourite things to do last year built as a full damage spell caster unlike the auto damage build this build gives massive damage to your q and can almost half health a squishy target plus your autos hurt too with the amount of damage and amour pen you end up with
